prompt: Create a simple Playdate game in C with a moving player sprite. The player should move left and right with the D-pad, and the crank controls their speed. Show me the main.c entry point and the player update logic.
assertions: The code includes the eventHandler function as the entry point
A global PlaydateAPI pointer (g_pd) is declared
The code uses Playdate APIs via g_pd (e.g., g_pd->system->getButtonState, g_pd->system->getCrankChange)
The player is represented as a struct with snake_case fields
Memory allocation uses g_pd->system->realloc instead of malloc
The game uses g_pd->system->setUpdateCallback for the game loop
